Sentencas: Background: Gadolinium-doped ceria (GDC) is a promising alternative as a solid electrolyte for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells (ITSOFCs) due to its low operating temperature and its high electrical conductivity.
Titulo: Electrical and microstructural characterization of ceramic gadolinium-doped ceria electrolytes for ITSOFCs by sol-gel route

Sentencas: The traditional synthesis processes require extended time for powder preparation.
Titulo: Electrical and microstructural characterization of ceramic gadolinium-doped ceria electrolytes for ITSOFCs by sol-gel route

Sentencas: Sol-gel methodology for electrolyte fabrication is more versatile and efficient.
Titulo: Electrical and microstructural characterization of ceramic gadolinium-doped ceria electrolytes for ITSOFCs by sol-gel route

Sentencas: Methods: In this work, nanocrystalline ceria powders, with 10 and 20 mol% of gadolinium (Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 and Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9) were synthesized by a modified sol-gel technique, featuring a nitrate-fuel exothermic reaction.
Titulo: Electrical and microstructural characterization of ceramic gadolinium-doped ceria electrolytes for ITSOFCs by sol-gel route

Sentencas: GDC tablets were prepared from powders and sintered at 1500 degrees C with a dwell time of 3 hours.
Titulo: Electrical and microstructural characterization of ceramic gadolinium-doped ceria electrolytes for ITSOFCs by sol-gel route

Sentencas: The sintered pellets' microstructure (by SEM) and electrical conductivity (by EIS) were evaluated.
Titulo: Electrical and microstructural characterization of ceramic gadolinium-doped ceria electrolytes for ITSOFCs by sol-gel route

Sentencas: The powder properties, such as crystalline structure (by XRD), thermal properties (TGA/DTA), particle size and morphology (TEM) and textural properties (BET method) were determined and, in addition, for the first time an accurate chemical structural evolution (FTIR) was studied.
Titulo: Electrical and microstructural characterization of ceramic gadolinium-doped ceria electrolytes for ITSOFCs by sol-gel route

Sentencas: Results: Sintered GDC0.8 samples exhibited the maximum theoretical density of 97% and an average grain size of 700 nm.
Titulo: Electrical and microstructural characterization of ceramic gadolinium-doped ceria electrolytes for ITSOFCs by sol-gel route

Sentencas: The electrical conductivity vs. temperature showed values ranging from 1.9.10(-2) to 5.5.10(-2) S.cm(-1) at 600 degrees C and 800 degrees C for GDC with 20 mol% of gadolinium.
Titulo: Electrical and microstructural characterization of ceramic gadolinium-doped ceria electrolytes for ITSOFCs by sol-gel route

Sentencas: Conclusions: The methodology investigated showed reduced reaction time, a better control of stoichiometry and low cost.
Titulo: Electrical and microstructural characterization of ceramic gadolinium-doped ceria electrolytes for ITSOFCs by sol-gel route

Sentencas: Characterization results demonstrated that these materials can be applied in ITSOFCs due to high conductivity, even at 550 degrees C-600 degrees C.
Titulo: Electrical and microstructural characterization of ceramic gadolinium-doped ceria electrolytes for ITSOFCs by sol-gel route

Sentencas: The increased conductivity is related to the improved mobility of gadolinium ions in a high-density structure, with nanometric grains.
Titulo: Electrical and microstructural characterization of ceramic gadolinium-doped ceria electrolytes for ITSOFCs by sol-gel route
